Key Match Events: Andrés Giménez drilled an RBI single into right field off Twins lefty Caleb Thielbar to score automatic runner José Ramírez for Cleveland’s second straight walk-off victory and seventh of the season.
The Guardians notched their 42nd comeback win while improving the best home record in the AL to 48-28.
Giménez’s base hit touched off a wild celebration between first and second base.
It was the fourth career walk-off plate appearance for Giménez and his second this season.
Guardians rookie Joey Cantillo pitched into the fifth inning before turning things over to the top-ranked bullpen in baseball.
Cleveland relievers tossed 5 2/3 scoreless innings, holding the Twins hitless and striking out eight.
Minnesota threatened to score in the top of the 10th as Eli Morgan loaded the bases by hitting Matt Wallner with a pitch and walking Manuel Margot.
Morgan retired Carlos Correa on a pop to first base in foul territory and escaped the inning when Byron Buxton sent a fly ball to Lane Thomas in right for the final out.

Rookie designated hitter Kyle Manzardo opened the scoring when he yanked a changeup from Twins starter Simeon Woods Richardson into the seats in right for his fourth home run and second of the series.
Post-Match Reflections: Andrés Giménez said, 'I mean, that’s us, that’s the Cleveland Guardians this whole year. We never give up. The guys in the bullpen really give us a chance to stay in the game, and from there we just have to do our job and try to keep the line moving.'

Manager Stephen Vogt said, 'We just started hugging. Alby (bench coach Craig Albernaz) and just what this group has been through. This is really special. The goal is to get in and then from here we keep pushing. Once you get in, you have a chance.'

Joey Cantillo said, 'Everyone’s been saying all year, everybody on this team loves each other and plays for each other. It doesn’t matter if you’re down three, down two or tied, this team is going to fight until the 27th out.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians clinched a Major League Baseball playoff spot with a 3-2 win in 10 innings against the Twins at Progressive Field.
The Guardians were not a popular pick to reach the playoffs when the season started, but have spent the last 23 weeks perched atop the American League Central Division.
Cleveland became the second team in the AL to claim a spot in the playoffs after the Yankees.
It marks the 17th playoff appearance in franchise history for the club with baseball’s longest World Series championship drought, a dry spell that dates back to 1948.
